name: Claremont Hotel Club & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I feel so lucky to have the beautiful Claremont Hotel right in our backyard. We just came back from the most relaxing stay-cation ever. For $300 dollars, we got a package that came with a beautiful room with a bay view, breakfast for two, access to the club, and free parking. Had dinner at the Paragon, the more casual of the two full service restaurants at the hotel. Played 90 minutes of tennis on the pristine courts. Had a soak in the jacuzzi back in our room. In the morning, I went to a great vinyasa yoga class, took a swim, sat in the spa, then had breakfast in the main restaurant, which also had a stunning view of the bay. We feel totally renewed.
reviews.title: A mini-vacation 10 minutes from home

reviews.text: We've stayed at the Claremont a few times in the past 5 or so years and had mixed feelings: a great historic elegant building, beautiful grounds, fantastic outdoor pools, but we didn't always have a good room (dark or small) or great experiences with the front desk. This recent trip made us feel like we were staying at a different Claremont, one where the staff and the facilities were on even--and excellent--footing. The front desk people (and I spoke with them all it seems) could not have been more engaged or caring about our requests. They worked hard to help us find the best room for our family. The manager was personable and quite friendly and accommodating as was the concierge. This friendly and professional manner extended to the fitness room staff who greeted us by name on day 2 (!) and I was greeted warmly by every staff member (well, maybe not the valet guys) when I was walking around the hotel. Great work out facility, the best at any hotel I have been too. We look forward to returning to the Claremont.
reviews.title: A Change for the Better

reviews.text: Beautiful: The setting. The main part of the hotel. The views. The tennis. The housekeepers, coffee gal, and bell men. Berkeley.
reviews.title: The Beautiful and The Damned (and the Annoying)

reviews.text: The Damned: Probably the rudest, least helpful, most arrogant check in/registration staff (and this is not one shift, repeated issues with every team over an entire weekend) (we average about 50 hotel nights a year, so this is kind of an accomplishment.) BIlling and accounting errors that will probably plague the visit for months, because of these women. And can someone replace that hideous rose carpet? It was ugly when new, but now....
reviews.title: The Grand Dame is in need of a Facelift.

reviews.text: The Annoying: Inconvenient hotel rooms, expensive parking, having free coffee in teh Club? C'mon...do what the W and Starwood does and put it in the lobby!
reviews.title: Double check your credit card statement after your stay

reviews.text: We were very pleased with the facilities at the Claremont Hotel. Our room was very comfortable and luxurious. The health club and spa were excellent. However, we were very disappointed with our dinner at the the Paragon restraunant at the Claremont. As my husband said,"It was the worst expensive meal he'd ever had". Basically, it was the type on entree one would be served at a large banquet.
reviews.title: Great facilities, poor dining

reviews.text: This was my first experience at the Claremont...ALL OF THE STAFF WAS VERY HELPFUL AND KNOWLEDGEABLE; HOWEVER, MR. JAMES MAY AT THE FRONT DESK WAS EXCEPTIONAL. During the stay - six days - he consistently was responsive, engaging, extremely helpful and focused on providing quality service to me as a guest.
reviews.title: THE CLAREMONT EXPERIENCE - MR. JAMES MAY

reviews.text: Mr. Mays' performance was especially helpful as I am disabled in my back and legs and use a power scooter. Consistently, he focused on trying to assure that my experience was "honoring" of someone who is disabled, in a city that often was not user friendly, "especially in the Oakland area". From assuring that heat was in my room, robes, information on services, restaurants, notable sites, etc; Mr Mays was an excellent representative of your hotel.
reviews.title: Even better than last time

reviews.text: Respectfully,

reviews.title: Love the Claremont

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rate this experience as very good solely because the room we were assigned had a fabulous view, perhaps the best in the hotel. Many of the other rooms are very small and have no bay views. Our problems were all with the front desk and support staff. They began with check-in, which we first attempted at 2:30 pm; we were told that our room was not ready yet, but that was understandable because check-in time was 4 pm. It was raining so we had to wait in the lobby. The front desk associates were having problems with the computers and were admittedly chagrinned, but even so they were curt, unfriendly and not in the least bit helpful. Even though use of the spa facilities had been included at an extra charge of $25 and we could have been given access to them during that time, we were not. I also wanted to make a reservation at the hotel's Meritage Restaurant, but the they told me that only the concierge could do that and (he)she was not at (his)her station, so I had to check back every 15 minutes until she finally appeared at her desk one hour later. We checked our baggage while we waited for our room, but when we finally got our room the bell clerk was not at his station and so we couldn't get our luggage; nor could a clerk be found to take our room number and deliver our bags when he finally returned. On the good side, the lobby gardens and spa are still very grand. The Meritage Restaurant cuisine is quite excellent (and expensive) but you can order small plates at about 1/2 price of a full meal. Also, if friends are joining you for dinner, parking is free (for 2 hours).
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently my spouse and I went on a couples trip with four other couples to the Claremont. The manager helped us out by arranging it so that we could all be in adjacent rooms - much appreciated. The amenities (ie. pool, gym, etc) are also part of what appears to be a club membership for locals living in the area. We thought that might create too large a crowd to use anything but that was not the case. I have read some reviews stating that some were annoyed by having to pay for club access and parking - that would also annoy me. We purchased a package through living social and the club access and parking were included so it was not an issue for us. The club is like a typical "tennis club" with several tennis courts and two large lap pools. We were able to use everything we desired with little or no wait. We were also worried about some reviews stating that the rooms were dated and in need of renovation. We disagree. We stayed in 801 through 805 so I can only speak to these rooms, but they were very nice rooms, especially for the area.
reviews.title: Couples trip - 4/6/12

reviews.text: I stayed at the Claremont two weekends in a row. My boyfriend and I joined some friends in staying at the resort and enjoyed the spa, the Meritage, and the Paragon. I fell in love with it! The service was amazing, and the accomodations were near perfection. THe very next weekend I brought my Mom and Daughter up for Easter weekend. This time, the stay was not as pleasureable. We requested a Bay view, which we received, but there were some real problems with the room. To beign with, there were dead flies in the bathroom. The bathroom blinds were filthy, there was no facial soap, and we had a half-empty bottle of lotion that was clearly left from the previous guests. To top it off, we were left with only one roll of toilet paper, which ran out the morning of our departure. We were left to use tissue. Housekeeping did not seem to be on their job in that particular room. I called and left a message for Mr. Primm, but have yet to receive a call back. I was incredibly disappointed. Like I stated, I fell in love with the hotel and had plans to return in early May, but am now having second thoughts. Needless to say,staying two weekends in a row was not inexpensive...andI expected a little more. I am sad that my love for the hotel lasted only two weekends. :-(
reviews.title: Couldn't get enough....until.....

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Claremont several times now and have had a very variable experience. While the gym and outdoor pools are excellent and the food is always good, the rooms are extremely diverse in their quality. I have stayed in some rooms that are truly five star and are large, modern and well furnished. And other rooms that are more like a cheap motel room with virtually no sound insulation, outdated airconditioning units, musty smelling and with small and dated bathrooms. I've not been able so far to figure out which are the good rooms and which are the bad ones.
reviews.title: Excellent gym and good food but very variable quality rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get a good room, you'll be raving about this place, but if you get a bad room, then you will leave feeling short-changed for what you pay.
reviews.title: Claremont Bliss

reviews.text: From the outside, this property looks stunning - all white, reminiscent of the "Falcon Crest" house. Its a large hotel with an apparently celebrated spa and a huge sports club with many tennis courts. The location is not quite convenient even when you consider that Berkeley is not a terribly huge town. So if you do plan on staying in this hotel, do rent a car.
reviews.title: This hotel has seen its best days passed by.

reviews.text: The reception staff are generally friendly, but also quite slow and inefficient. So there were long queues upon checking in and out.
reviews.title: Historic but mediocre

reviews.text: This is really an "old world" hotel but I suspect, it has seen its best days and is in desperate need of refurbishment and renewal. Some may well call it "old world charm", but I think it will be increasingly difficult to justify this. The standard of housekeeping is inconsistent - sometimes acceptable, sometimes plain bad. I had for eg asked for some additional bathroom accessories to be provided daily, but had to keep reminding each housekeeper of it. Clearly, no communication amongst the staff.
reviews.title: Two Consecutive Disappointing Stays, Don't Plan to Return
Beautiful Hotel with great personality
reviews.text: The bed was fairly comfortable, but was "squeaky" indicating its advanced age.

reviews.text: Breakfast was average and the menu was limited.
reviews.title: Beyond my expectations~

description: Since 1915, the Claremont has pampered guests at the level expected of a AAA Four-Diamond award winning hotel. With stress melting spa treatments, a wide range of fitness options, special events, live music, and endless culinary delights, you’ll find the Claremont engaging - even if you choose to simply engage in quality time alone. We deliver attentive service with a gracious hospitality casual enough to make you feel right at home.
